alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 11:13PM EST until February 04 at 2:44PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Cumming. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 6.7 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
